snippet: A $50,000 grant and more than $30,000 in donations will allow a women’s shelter in a remote Alaskan Native village to continue operating.
abstract: Emmonak Women's Shelter in Emmonak, Alaska, will reopen following a $50,000 emergency grant from the federal government and more than $30,000 in donations from the public; shelter, which closed due to lack of funding, serves about 500 women and children a year in a region where the rates of sexual assault and domestic violence are far higher than national averages.
lead_paragraph: A $50,000 grant and more than $30,000 in donations will allow a women’s shelter in a remote Alaskan Native village to continue operating.

headline.main: With Grant, an Alaska Women’s Shelter Can Reopen
headline.print_headline: With Grant, an Alaska Women’s Shelter Can Reopen
